member.name: T:MessagePack.MessagePackKnownFormatterAttribute
member.summary: Identifies a custom formatter (one that implements one or more IMessagePackFormatter<T> interfaces) that should be considered when checking that types are serializable and/or included in a source-generated resolver.
member.remarks: Formatters identified with this attribute will be included in the source-generated resolver.

member.name: P:MessagePack.MessagePackKnownFormatterAttribute.FormatterType
member.summary: Gets a type that implements one or more IMessagePackFormatter<T> interfaces.

member.name: T:MessagePack.MessagePackAssumedFormattableAttribute
member.summary: Identifies a type for which a IMessagePackFormatter<T> exists and will be added manually to the IFormatterResolver by the program.

remarks.para: This attribute suppresses warnings by the MessagePack analyzer when it encounters references to the specified type within another serializable type.
When possible, using the is preferred.

member.name: P:MessagePack.MessagePackAssumedFormattableAttribute.FormattableType
member.summary: Gets a type for which an IMessagePackFormatter<T> is known to exist and will be added via a custom resolver by the program at runtime.

member.name: T:MessagePack.ExcludeFormatterFromSourceGeneratedResolverAttribute
member.summary: Causes the source generated resolver, which typically includes all implementations of IMessagePackFormatter<T>, to exclude this particular formatter.
member.remarks: This is useful when the formatter is intended for special case members, which may apply the to select the private formatter.

member.name: P:MessagePack.MessagePackObjectAttribute.KeyAsPropertyName
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to automatically serialize all internal and public fields and properties using their property name as the key in a map.

member.name: M:MessagePack.MessagePackObjectAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: to automatically serialize all internal and public fields and properties using their property name as the key in a map; or to use the attribute to specify the key for each field or property.

member.name: P:MessagePack.MessagePackObjectAttribute.SuppressSourceGeneration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the source generator should not generate a formatter for this type at compile-time.
member.remarks: By default, source generators will generate a formatter for every type that is annotated with this attribute to improve startup performance. However if this leads to malfunctions during code generation or at runtime, it can be disabled by setting this property to . When no precompiled formatter is found at runtime, the DynamicObjectResolver will generate a formatter at runtime instead.

member.name: P:MessagePack.UnionAttribute.Key
member.summary: Gets the distinguishing value that identifies a particular subtype.

member.name: P:MessagePack.UnionAttribute.SubType
member.summary: Gets the derived or implementing type.

member.name: M:MessagePack.UnionAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The distinguishing value that identifies a particular subtype.

member.name: M:MessagePack.UnionAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The distinguishing value that identifies a particular subtype.
The full name (should be assembly qualified) of the derived or implementing type.
